data.route_analysis: Direct flights to Reykjavik from major cities in Europe; bus and car rental options available for local travel.
data.seasonal_patterns: Peak season for Northern Lights is from late September to early April, with optimal conditions typically found in January and February.
data.climate: Winter temperatures range from -1°C to 4°C (30°F to 39°F). Snow and ice are common, so warm clothing and reliable footwear are recommended.
data.culture: Traditional Icelandic festivals in winter include Þorrablót, celebrating the mid-winter. The culture is rich with Viking history and folklore.
data.attractions: Top attractions include the Golden Circle (Thingvellir, Geysir, Gullfoss), Blue Lagoon, and Northern Lights Viewing Spots.
